agentSwitchArpAgeoutTime.name: agentSwitchArpAgeoutTime
agentSwitchArpAgeoutTime.description: Configures the ARP entry ageout time in seconds. Allowable range: 15-21600

agentSwitchArpResponseTime.name: agentSwitchArpResponseTime
agentSwitchArpResponseTime.description: Configures the ARP request response timeout in seconds. Allowable range: 1-10

agentSwitchArpMaxRetries.name: agentSwitchArpMaxRetries
agentSwitchArpMaxRetries.description: Configures the ARP count of maximum request for retries. Allowable range: 0-10

agentSwitchArpCacheSize.name: agentSwitchArpCacheSize
agentSwitchArpCacheSize.description: Configures the ARP maximum number of entries in the cache. Allowable range is platform-specific.

agentSwitchArpDynamicRenew.name: agentSwitchArpDynamicRenew
agentSwitchArpDynamicRenew.description: This indicates the current setting of ARP dynamic renew mode.

agentSwitchArpTotalEntryCountCurrent.name: agentSwitchArpTotalEntryCountCurrent
agentSwitchArpTotalEntryCountCurrent.description: Current number of entries in the ARP cache.

agentSwitchArpTotalEntryCountPeak.name: agentSwitchArpTotalEntryCountPeak
agentSwitchArpTotalEntryCountPeak.description: Peak number of entries recorded in the ARP cache over time. This value is restarted whenever the ARP cache size is changed.

agentSwitchArpStaticEntryCountCurrent.name: agentSwitchArpStaticEntryCountCurrent
agentSwitchArpStaticEntryCountCurrent.description: Current number of configured static ARP entries.

agentSwitchArpStaticEntryCountMax.name: agentSwitchArpStaticEntryCountMax
agentSwitchArpStaticEntryCountMax.description: Maximum number of configurable static ARP entries.

agentSwitchArpTable.name: agentSwitchArpTable
agentSwitchArpTable.description: This table augments the MIB-II ipNetToMediaTable by providing per-interface ARP entry information.

agentSwitchArpAge.name: agentSwitchArpAge
agentSwitchArpAge.description: This defines the time (in seconds) since the ARP entry was last refreshed. This value is 0 for ARP entries of type local(1) or static(3), since these entries are not subject to aging.

agentSwitchArpIpAddress.name: agentSwitchArpIpAddress
agentSwitchArpIpAddress.description: The IP Address assigned to each interface.

agentSwitchArpMacAddress.name: agentSwitchArpMacAddress
agentSwitchArpMacAddress.description: The hardware MAX Address that each interface maps to.

agentSwitchArpInterface.name: agentSwitchArpInterface
agentSwitchArpInterface.description: The Associated IfIndex which identified the ARP Entry.

agentSwitchArpStatus.name: agentSwitchArpStatus
agentSwitchArpStatus.description: The status of this ARP entry. Setting this object destroy will remove the entry.

agentSwitchIpRoutingMode.name: agentSwitchIpRoutingMode
agentSwitchIpRoutingMode.description: Administratively enables/disables routing on the switch.

agentSwitchIpInterfaceIfIndex.name: agentSwitchIpInterfaceIfIndex
agentSwitchIpInterfaceIfIndex.description: The IfIndex associated with this instance.

agentSwitchIpInterfaceIpAddress.name: agentSwitchIpInterfaceIpAddress
agentSwitchIpInterfaceIpAddress.description: The IpAddress assigned to this interface. When setting this value, the value of agentSwitchIpInterfaceNetMask must be set at the same time.

agentSwitchIpInterfaceNetMask.name: agentSwitchIpInterfaceNetMask
agentSwitchIpInterfaceNetMask.description: The NetMask assigned to this interface. When setting this value, the value of agentSwitchIpInterfaceIpAddress must be set at the same time.

agentSwitchIpInterfaceClearIp.name: agentSwitchIpInterfaceClearIp
agentSwitchIpInterfaceClearIp.description: Sets the interfaces IpAddress and NetMask back to 0.0.0.0

agentSwitchIpInterfaceRoutingMode.name: agentSwitchIpInterfaceRoutingMode
agentSwitchIpInterfaceRoutingMode.description: Enables or disables routing for this interface.

agentSwitchIpRouterDiscoveryTable.name: agentSwitchIpRouterDiscoveryTable
agentSwitchIpRouterDiscoveryTable.description: There is no global administrative flag for router discovery. The global routing flag (agentSwitchIpRoutingMode) will be used for this purpose. If routing is disabled, router discovery is disabled as well.

agentSwitchIpRouterDiscoveryIfIndex.name: agentSwitchIpRouterDiscoveryIfIndex
agentSwitchIpRouterDiscoveryIfIndex.description: Interface Number to configure Router Discovery on.

agentSwitchIpRouterDiscoveryAdvertiseMod.name: agentSwitchIpRouterDiscoveryAdvertiseMode
agentSwitchIpRouterDiscoveryAdvertiseMod.description: Enable or disable router discovery on the interface.

agentSwitchIpRouterDiscoveryMaxAdvertise.name: agentSwitchIpRouterDiscoveryMaxAdvertisementInterval
agentSwitchIpRouterDiscoveryMaxAdvertise.description: Maximum time allowed between sending router advertisements from the interface.

agentSwitchIpRouterDiscoveryMinAdvertise.name: agentSwitchIpRouterDiscoveryMinAdvertisementInterval
agentSwitchIpRouterDiscoveryMinAdvertise.description: Minimum time allowed between sending router advertisements from the interface. This value must be less than or equal to agentSwitchIpRouterDiscoveryMaxAdvertisementInterval.

agentSwitchIpRouterDiscoveryAdvertisemen.name: agentSwitchIpRouterDiscoveryAdvertisementLifetime
agentSwitchIpRouterDiscoveryAdvertisemen.description: Value of lifetime field of router advertsisement sent from the interface. This value must be greater than or equal to agentSwitchIpRouterDiscoveryMaxAdvertisementInterval.

agentSwitchIpRouterDiscoveryPreferenceLe.name: agentSwitchIpRouterDiscoveryPreferenceLevel
agentSwitchIpRouterDiscoveryPreferenceLe.description: Preferability of the address as a default router address, related to other addresses on the same subnet. This is defined as the larger the number, the higher the preference.

agentSwitchIpRouterDiscoveryAdvertisemen.name: agentSwitchIpRouterDiscoveryAdvertisementAddress
agentSwitchIpRouterDiscoveryAdvertisemen.description: Address used when sending router advertisements from the interface.

agentSwitchIpVlanEntry.name: agentSwitchIpVlanEntry
agentSwitchIpVlanEntry.description: A Static VLAN for which routing can be enabled/disabled

agentSwitchIpVlanIfIndex.name: agentSwitchIpVlanIfIndex
agentSwitchIpVlanIfIndex.description: The IfIndex associated with this VLAN.

agentSwitchIpVlanRoutingStatus.name: agentSwitchIpVlanRoutingStatus
agentSwitchIpVlanRoutingStatus.description: Status of Routing mode per Vlan. active(1) - Vlan is enabled for routing createAndGo(4) - Adds Vlan entry for routing destroy(6) - Removes Vlan from routing

agentRouterRipAdminState.name: agentRouterRipAdminState
agentRouterRipAdminState.description: Sets the administrative mode of RIP in the router.

agentRouterRipSplitHorizonMode.name: agentRouterRipSplitHorizonMode
agentRouterRipSplitHorizonMode.description: Sets the RIP split horizon operating mode in the router. A value of none(1) means split horizon processing is disabled. When set to simple(2), the simple split horizon technique is used. When set to poisonReverse(3), the split horizon with poison reverse technique is used. The default split horizon mode is simple(2).

agentRouterRipAutoSummaryMode.name: agentRouterRipAutoSummaryMode
agentRouterRipAutoSummaryMode.description: Sets the RIP auto summarization mode in the router. A value of enable(1) means that routes advertized by this RIP router are combined, or summarized, whenever possible into aggregates. When set to disable(2), routes are not aggregated in RIP updates generated by this router. The default auto summary mode is enable(1).

agentRouterRipHostRoutesAcceptMode.name: agentRouterRipHostRoutesAcceptMode
agentRouterRipHostRoutesAcceptMode.description: Sets the RIP host route acceptance mode in the router. A value of enable(1) means that host routes advertized to this RIP router will be accepted (learned) into its routing table. When set to disable(2), host routes advertized in RIP updates from neighboring routers are ignored. The default host routes accept mode is enable(1).

agentRouterRipDefaultMetric.name: agentRouterRipDefaultMetric
agentRouterRipDefaultMetric.description: Default metric of redistributed routes, when RIP redistributes from other protocols.

agentRouterRipDefaultMetricConfigured.name: agentRouterRipDefaultMetricConfigured
agentRouterRipDefaultMetricConfigured.description: Flag to determine whether RIP default-metric is configured or not.

agentRouterRipDefaultInfoOriginate.name: agentRouterRipDefaultInfoOriginate
agentRouterRipDefaultInfoOriginate.description: Flag to determine, whether RIP can advertise a default-route learned from another protocol.

agentRipRouteRedistTable.name: agentRipRouteRedistTable
agentRipRouteRedistTable.description: This table contains the MIB objects required to configure route-redistribution for RIP. Here, RIP is the Destination protocol and the source protocols can be any of : BGP, OSPF, Static, Connected.

agentRipRouteRedistSource.name: agentRipRouteRedistSource
agentRipRouteRedistSource.description: Source route, from which RIP can redistribute routes. This object also acts as the identifier for the RIP redistribution Table entry.

agentRipRouteRedistMode.name: agentRipRouteRedistMode
agentRipRouteRedistMode.description: User enabels/disables route-redistribution for a particular source protocol.

agentRipRouteRedistMetric.name: agentRipRouteRedistMetric
agentRipRouteRedistMetric.description: Metric used for redistributing a particular source protocol route into RIP.

agentRipRouteRedistMetricConfigured.name: agentRipRouteRedistMetricConfigured
agentRipRouteRedistMetricConfigured.description: Flag to determine whether RIP redistribute-metric is configured or not.

agentRipRouteRedistMatchInternal.name: agentRipRouteRedistMatchInternal
agentRipRouteRedistMatchInternal.description: If this flag is true, RIP redistributes OSPF internal routes. It will be non-applicable, when source protocol is other than ospf.

agentRipRouteRedistMatchExternal1.name: agentRipRouteRedistMatchExternal1
agentRipRouteRedistMatchExternal1.description: If this flag is true, RIP redistributes OSPF External1 routes. It will be non-applicable, when source protocol is other than ospf.

agentRipRouteRedistMatchExternal2.name: agentRipRouteRedistMatchExternal2
agentRipRouteRedistMatchExternal2.description: If this flag is true, RIP redistributes OSPF External2 routes. It will be non-applicable, when source protocol is other than ospf.

agentRipRouteRedistMatchNSSAExternal1.name: agentRipRouteRedistMatchNSSAExternal1
agentRipRouteRedistMatchNSSAExternal1.description: If this flag is true, RIP redistributes OSPF NSSA-External1 routes. It will be non-applicable, when source protocol is other than ospf.

agentRipRouteRedistMatchNSSAExternal2.name: agentRipRouteRedistMatchNSSAExternal2
agentRipRouteRedistMatchNSSAExternal2.description: If this flag is true, RIP redistributes OSPF NSSA-External2 routes. It will be non-applicable, when source protocol is other than ospf.

agentRipRouteRedistDistList.name: agentRipRouteRedistDistList
agentRipRouteRedistDistList.description: Access-list number of the access-list, which filters routes received from a source-protocol.

agentRipRouteRedistDistListConfigured.name: agentRipRouteRedistDistListConfigured
agentRipRouteRedistDistListConfigured.description: Flag to determine whether Access-list is configured or not.

agentRip2IfConfTable.name: agentRip2IfConfTable
agentRip2IfConfTable.description: A list of subnets which require separate configuration in RIP. Augments rip2IfConfTable in the RIPv2-MIB.

agentRip2IfConfEntry.name: agentRip2IfConfEntry
agentRip2IfConfEntry.description: A Single Routing Domain in a single Subnet. Augments rip2IfConfEntry in RIPv2-MIB.

agentRip2IfConfAuthKeyId.name: agentRip2IfConfAuthKeyId
agentRip2IfConfAuthKeyId.description: The identifier for the authentication key used on this interface. This field is only meaningful when the RIPv2-MIB rip2IfConfAuthType is md5(3); otherwise, the value is not used.

agentOspfDefaultMetric.name: agentOspfDefaultMetric
agentOspfDefaultMetric.description: Default metric of redistributed routes, when OSPF redistributes from other protocols.

agentOspfDefaultMetricConfigured.name: agentOspfDefaultMetricConfigured
agentOspfDefaultMetricConfigured.description: Flag to determine whether OSPF default-metric is configured or not.

agentOspfDefaultInfoOriginate.name: agentOspfDefaultInfoOriginate
agentOspfDefaultInfoOriginate.description: Flag to determine, whether OSPF can advertise a default-route learned from another protocol.

agentOspfDefaultInfoOriginateAlways.name: agentOspfDefaultInfoOriginateAlways
agentOspfDefaultInfoOriginateAlways.description: When this flag is true, the router advertises 0.0.0.0/0.0.0.0 always. Without this option, OSPF will only advertise 0.0.0.0/0.0.0.0 if the router's forwarding table contains a default route.

agentOspfDefaultInfoOriginateMetric.name: agentOspfDefaultInfoOriginateMetric
agentOspfDefaultInfoOriginateMetric.description: Metric of the default route,which OSPF advertises when learned from other protocol.

agentOspfDefaultInfoOriginateMetricConfi.name: agentOspfDefaultInfoOriginateMetricConfigured
agentOspfDefaultInfoOriginateMetricConfi.description: Flag to determine whether OSPF default-info originate metric is configured or not.

agentOspfDefaultInfoOriginateMetricType.name: agentOspfDefaultInfoOriginateMetricType
agentOspfDefaultInfoOriginateMetricType.description: Metric Type of the default route,which OSPF advertises when learned from other protocol. It can be 1(external type 1) or 2(external type 2).

agentOspfRouteRedistTable.name: agentOspfRouteRedistTable
agentOspfRouteRedistTable.description: This table contains the MIB objects required to configure route-redistribution for OSPF. Here, OSPF is the Destination protocol and the source protocols can be any of : BGP, RIP, Static, Connected.

agentOspfRouteRedistSource.name: agentOspfRouteRedistSource
agentOspfRouteRedistSource.description: Source protocol, from which OSPF can redistribute routes. This object also acts as the identifier for the OSPF redistribution Table entry.

agentOspfRouteRedistMode.name: agentOspfRouteRedistMode
agentOspfRouteRedistMode.description: User enabels/disables route-redistribution for a particular source protocol.

agentOspfRouteRedistMetric.name: agentOspfRouteRedistMetric
agentOspfRouteRedistMetric.description: Metric used for redistributing a particular source protocol route into OSPF.

agentOspfRouteRedistMetricConfigured.name: agentOspfRouteRedistMetricConfigured
agentOspfRouteRedistMetricConfigured.description: Flag to determine whether OSPF redistribute-metric is configured or not.

agentOspfRouteRedistMetricType.name: agentOspfRouteRedistMetricType
agentOspfRouteRedistMetricType.description: Metric Type of routes,which OSPF redistributes from other source protocols. It can be 1(external type 1) or 2(external type 2).

agentOspfRouteRedistTag.name: agentOspfRouteRedistTag
agentOspfRouteRedistTag.description: It specifies the tag field in routes redistributed by OSPF.

agentOspfRouteRedistSubnets.name: agentOspfRouteRedistSubnets
agentOspfRouteRedistSubnets.description: If this value is false, then OSPF will not redistribute subnetted routes.

agentOspfRouteRedistDistList.name: agentOspfRouteRedistDistList
agentOspfRouteRedistDistList.description: Access-list number of the access-list, which filters routes received from a source-protocol.

agentOspfRouteRedistDistListConfigured.name: agentOspfRouteRedistDistListConfigured
agentOspfRouteRedistDistListConfigured.description: Flag to determine whether Access-list is configured or not.

agentOspfIfTable.name: agentOspfIfTable
agentOspfIfTable.description: The OSPF Interface Table describes the inter- faces from the viewpoint of OSPF. Augments ospfIfTable from the OSPF-MIB.

agentOspfIfEntry.name: agentOspfIfEntry
agentOspfIfEntry.description: The OSPF Interface Entry describes one inter- face from the viewpoint of OSPF. Augments ospfIfEntry in OSPF-MIB.

agentOspfIfAuthKeyId.name: agentOspfIfAuthKeyId
agentOspfIfAuthKeyId.description: The identifier for the authentication key used on this interface. This field is only meaningful when the OSPF-MIB ospfIfAuthType is md5(2); otherwise, the value is not used.

agentOspfVirtIfTable.name: agentOspfVirtIfTable
agentOspfVirtIfTable.description: Information about this router's virtual inter- faces. Augments ospfVirtIfTable from the OSPF-MIB.

agentOspfVirtIfEntry.name: agentOspfVirtIfEntry
agentOspfVirtIfEntry.description: Information about a single Virtual Interface. Augments ospfVirtIfEntry in OSPF-MIB.

agentOspfVirtIfAuthKeyId.name: agentOspfVirtIfAuthKeyId
agentOspfVirtIfAuthKeyId.description: The identifier for the authentication key used on this virtual interface. This field is only meaningful when the OSPF-MIB ospfVirtIfAuthType is md5(2); otherwise, the value is not used.

agentRouterOspfRFC1583CompatibilityMode.name: agentRouterOspfRFC1583CompatibilityMode
agentRouterOspfRFC1583CompatibilityMode.description: From RFC2328: Controls the preference rules used in Section 16.4 when choosing among multiple AS-external-LSAs advertising the same destination. When set to 'enabled', the preference rules remain those specified by RFC 1583 ([Ref9]). When set to 'disabled', the preference rules are those stated in Section 16.4.1, which prevent routing loops when AS- external-LSAs for the same destination have been originated from different areas. Set to 'enabled' by default. In order to minimize the chance of routing loops, all OSPF routers in an OSPF routing domain should have RFC1583Compatibility set identically. When there are routers present that have not been updated with the functionality specified in Section 16.4.1 of this memo, all routers should have RFC1583Compatibility set to 'enabled'. Otherwise, all routers should have RFC1583Compatibility set to 'disabled', preventing all routing loops.

agentOspfAreaTable.name: agentOspfAreaTable
agentOspfAreaTable.description: Information describing the additional configured parameters and cumulative statistics of the router's attached areas.

agentOspfAreaEntry.name: agentOspfAreaEntry
agentOspfAreaEntry.description: Information describing the additional configured parameters and cumulative statistics of the router's attached areas.

agentOspfAuthType.name: agentOspfAuthType
agentOspfAuthType.description: The authentication type specified for an area. Additional authentication types may be assigned locally on a per Area basis.

agentSnmpVRRPNewMasterTrapFlag.name: agentSnmpVRRPNewMasterTrapFlag
agentSnmpVRRPNewMasterTrapFlag.description: This flag enables the sending of VRRP new master notification traps.

agentSnmpVRRPAuthFailureTrapFlag.name: agentSnmpVRRPAuthFailureTrapFlag
agentSnmpVRRPAuthFailureTrapFlag.description: This flag enables the sending of VRRP authentication failure notification traps.

agentBootpDhcpRelayMaxHopCount.name: agentBootpDhcpRelayMaxHopCount
agentBootpDhcpRelayMaxHopCount.description: The BOOTP/DHCP Max Hop Count. The relay agent silently discards BOOTREQUEST messages whose hops field exceeds the value 16 assuming that the request is looped through the intermediate agents. The default value is 4.

agentBootpDhcpRelayForwardingIp.name: agentBootpDhcpRelayForwardingIp
agentBootpDhcpRelayForwardingIp.description: The BOOTP/DHCP Server IP Address. All the requests will be forwarded and the replies expected from this address.

agentBootpDhcpRelayForwardMode.name: agentBootpDhcpRelayForwardMode
agentBootpDhcpRelayForwardMode.description: The BOOTP/DHCP Admin Mode. The relaying functionality can be administratively enabled or disabled by this object

agentBootpDhcpRelayMinWaitTime.name: agentBootpDhcpRelayMinWaitTime
agentBootpDhcpRelayMinWaitTime.description: The BOOTP/DHCP Minimum Wait Time. When the BOOTP relay agent receives a BOOTREQUEST message, it MAY use the value of the 'secs' (seconds since client began booting) field of the request as a factor in deciding whether to relay the request or not.

agentBootpDhcpRelayCircuitIdOptionMode.name: agentBootpDhcpRelayCircuitIdOptionMode
agentBootpDhcpRelayCircuitIdOptionMode.description: The BOOTP/DHCP Circuit ID Option Mode. This flag is set to enable/disable the network element to add/remove the DHCP Relay agent Circuit ID sub-options.

agentBootpDhcpRelayNumOfRequestsReceived.name: agentBootpDhcpRelayNumOfRequestsReceived
agentBootpDhcpRelayNumOfRequestsReceived.description: The Number of BOOTP/DHCP Requests Received. Total number of BOOTREQUESTs received from all clients.

agentBootpDhcpRelayNumOfRequestsForwarde.name: agentBootpDhcpRelayNumOfRequestsForwarded
agentBootpDhcpRelayNumOfRequestsForwarde.description: The Number of BOOTP/DHCP Requests Forwarded. Total number of BOOTREQUESTs forwarded to the next agents/servers.

agentBootpDhcpRelayNumOfDiscards.name: agentBootpDhcpRelayNumOfDiscards
agentBootpDhcpRelayNumOfDiscards.description: The Number of BOOTP/DHCP Discards. Total number of packets discarded by the network element because of error in the packet.
